Pre-Game Insights: India might look to make a few changes for the final game of the series.
Bangladesh has not offered any competition against India so far in the series.
Bangladesh's batting is a major weakness in their team.
Mahmudullah has announced his retirement from T20Is after the completion of the ongoing series.
Post-Match Reflections: India has won the series with a game remaining.
Bangladesh has lost by 86 runs and it is their biggest defeat against India.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The pre-winter T20I evening had a midsummer IPL-night feel in New Delhi.
India's template under the new regime has been the same, which helped them lift the T20 World Cup in Barbados.
Bangladesh batters seem to have been more in terms with the pace of the quickmen, however, it also seemed like the surface which is on the slower side has helped their cause as well.
Others: The second T20 international promises to be a run-fest.
The surface seems really hard, it's going to be a nightmare for the bowlers to bowl on this surface.
Teams that have batted first have won the games - five out of five in the IPL.
